contentrichtext.text: '''Walter Bishop, Jr.''' (October 4, 1927 – January 24, 1998) was an [[United States|American]] [[bebop|bop]] and [[hard bop]] [[jazz piano|jazz pianist]]. He was the son of composer [[Walter Bishop, Sr.]] In high school his friends included [[Kenny Drew]], [[Sonny Rollins]], and [[Art Taylor]]. He began his musical career after [[World War II]], and played and recorded with [[Art Blakey]], [[Charlie Parker]], [[Oscar Pettiford]], [[Kai Winding]], [[Miles Davis]], [[Jackie McLean]], [[Curtis Fuller]], [[Terry Gibbs]], [[Clark Terry]], [[Blue Mitchell]], and [[Supersax]]. In the early 1960s he also led his own trio with [[Jimmy Garrison]] and [[G. T. Hogan]]. He continued performing into the 1990s. After studying at [[The Juilliard School]] with [[Hall Overton]] in the late 1960s, he taught music theory at colleges in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]] in the 1970s. In 1983 he began teaching at [[The Hartt School]] of the [[University of Hartford]]. He also wrote a book, ''A Study in Fourths'', about jazz [[improvisation]] based on cycles of fourths and fifths. ==Discography== ===As leader=== * 1961: ''Speak Low'' also released as ''Milestones'' ([[Black Lion Records]]) * 1964: ''Bish Bash'' ([[Xanadu Records]]) * 1965: ''The Walter Bishop Jr. Trio'' ([[Prestige Records]]) also released as ''Summertime'' ([[Cotillion Records]]) * 1972: ''Coral Keys'' ([[Black Jazz Records]]) * 1973: ''Keeper Of My Soul'' (Black Jazz) * 1974: ''Valley Land'' ([[Muse Records]]) * 1976: ''Old Folks'' ([[East Wind Records]]) * 1977: ''Soul Village'' (Muse) * 1978: ''Cubicle'' (Muse) * 1978: ''The Trio'' (with Billy Hart, George Mraz) * 1979: ''Hot House'' (Muse) * 1988: ''Just in Time'' ([[Pony Canyon]] * 1989: ''Ode to Bird'' * 1991: ''Midnight Blue'' ([[Red Records|Red]])<ref>[http://www.allmusic.com/album/midnight-blue-r189931 Allmusic]</ref> * 1994: ''What's New'' ([[DIW Records]]) * 1993: ''Speak Low Again'' (with [[Paul Brown]], [[Al Harewood]])<ref>[http://www.allmusic.com/album/speak-low-again-r1418462 Allmusic]</ref> ===As sideman=== {{expand section|date=January 2012}} '''With [[Gene Ammons]]''' *''[[Up Tight!
